channel.title: I added a corrupt d long from RSMV models but it doesnt look correct?

item.title: I added a corrupt d long from RSMV models but it doesnt look correct?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Michaelmmm, post:7, topic:284096”]alright i get the right hand shit, the reason i put it on left hand is cause silentcj’s tut said to put a wep in the left hand so i was like k ill folow the fuckin tut?

Link for MQO Please?

And The file that i would edit to raise the sword would be .dat? the final one that i gzip for the client or what?

Oh and i’m sorry for being a fuckin idiot, NOT ALL OF US CAN UNDERSTAND THIS SHIT!

-As i said i STATED I STARTED TODAY 100%%%%%%%% So i BARELY know anything,once i get the hang of it, i will release MANY models for every one![/quote]

You obviously didn’t read the tutorial right then.

Taken straight from it.

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:1, topic:275142”]Look in the bottom left, when the wield model is selected, select right hand animation from the drop down menu, and set the priorities to 10 in the little text box. Outlined in red are the three things you will need to do, make .dat, being the last.

For the drop/inventory model, you do not need to add animation, just select no animation from the ddm.[/quote]

Oh and, don’t complain about the tutorial, give some appreciation, i took the time and effort to write it up.
Also, for your information, everything i know today, i did without tutorials, when i started modelling and using rsps clients, no tutorials even existed, i started the modelling here at moparscape off. I worked out everything myself, so you can do so yourself.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xcvxcv2 xcvxcv2
item.description:
@xcvxcv2 wrote:

Michaelmmm:

i got it to move up , thank u so much, see it took 2 minutes of ur time and u saved my ass 1hour of reading, some people like EDIT: NVM, and most of u think i would kno so much about this. i am a begginer god put up with this all day.

last post

now since it took you 2 mins to make it, read the WHOLE TUTORIAL this way you dont need to ask questions to us seem dumb

i am sorry people are being mean but when you come into this section we already assume that you read the tutorial teaching you the basics

please read the tutorial and i hope to see a lot of awesome models in your future

RECOMMENDED: make something very easy, for example a smile face on a cape, (dont post that, just for your own benefits)

good luck

item.title: I added a corrupt d long from RSMV models but it doesnt look correct?
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

Open the mqo in metesequoia. Then click select all so the model is green. Then click move. Then drag the green axis up.

EXTREMELY basic. If you need help with THAT then you shouldn’t be here

Read full topic
